Benchmark.title: Fedora security controls

description.html:p: This is a checklist of common secure system configuration settings (security controls) intended to be used as a reference for securing Fedora systems.

The checklist can be processed by varius tools which enable users to:
define profiles with customized security policies,
audit systems to determine compliance with targeted security policy and
adjust system configuration.

Benchmark.notice: This XCCDF has been automatically generated, it should only serve as a baseline!

description.html:p: This profile is designed for the default stock Fedora installation.
One of the use cases is to check for issues with upcoming Fedora versions.
This profile is designed for a hardened version of Fedora, it's much more strict than the default profile.
This profile is designed to check the security controls recommended by the Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG).
This profile is not an official STIG checklist implementation. The profile is not complete and may contain inaccuracies. Use at own discretion.
This profile is designed to check the security controls recommended by the National Industrial Security Program (NISPOM).
This profile is not an official NISPOM checklist implementation. The profile is not complete and may contain inaccuracies. Use at own discretion.

Profile.title: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard

description.html:p: This profile is designed to check some of the security controls required by the PCI DSS standard.
This profile is not an official PCI DSS checklist implementation. The profile is not complete and may contain inaccuracies. Use at own discretion.
